text: Is there any reason why I shouldn’t define `Base.broadcastable(w::GenBank.Writer) = Ref(w)` ? It would be convenient to be able to type `write.(w, chrs)`  instead of iterating over `chrs`, but I noticed it isn’t defined for other Writers

text:
I think that doesn't really fit with what people think about when they think about broadcasting. It's not so much "apply f to each element of x", but rather "create a new container with f applied to each element of x".
Perhaps it's better do just do `foreach(i -> write(w, i), chrs)`

text: I often use broadcasting for things that aren’t meant to create new containers, like `println.(strings)` , or `Makie.hidedecorations!.(axes)` , so I’m not really convinced. Since it would be inconsistent with everything else I’ll leave it out, though
